awd_titl_txt: Establishment of a Scholarship Program in Chemistry and Physics

por.por_cntn:
This project established a scholarship program at Wabash College to aid students pursuing degrees in the physical sciences. Each year of the grant, these students were placed into a science-themed freshman tutorial as part of a cohort-building model.  These tutorial courses, included Energy and the Environment, Rocketry in Science and Fiction, and Nuclear Power and Nuclear Weapons. The first cohort included a field excursion to visit a large wind power installation, a cattle and farming operation that genrates power from bio-gas made on site, and a small hydroelectric dam dating to the 1930s. The rocketry group built and launched model rockets, measured the thrust curves of sample engines and built models to predict their models' filghts. The nuclear power and weapons group read about current development in both fission and potential fusion reactor designs, and studied the history of the Manhattan Project. That group presented their final project as a performance open to the entire campus. 

These cohorts were then integrated into the student success and retention efforts of the college. Over the course of the grant, retention within the initial disciplinary programs of chemistry and physics was lower than anticipated and the group of allowed majors was expanded to include mathematics. During the grant period thirty-nine students were award these scholarships covering a portion of their studies. Of these students, twenty-nine completed their studies at Wabash College in four years, and twelve completed majors in the physical sciences and mathematics.
